channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft Corporation -- Kernel Mode Driver
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft Corporation -- Kernel Mode Driver

item.title: CVE-2017-8689|2024-09-17T01:27:08.558Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- kernel%20mode%20driver
item.description: The Microsoft Windows Kernel Mode Driver on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016 allows an elevation of privilege vulnerability when it fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-8694.

item.title: CVE-2017-8694|2024-09-17T02:47:18.435Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- kernel%20mode%20driver
item.description: The Microsoft Windows Kernel Mode Driver on Microsoft Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1, Windows 7 SP1, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016 allows an elevation of privilege vulnerability when it fails to properly handle objects in memory, aka "Win32k Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-8689.
